ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:0.4_0: 2. The training rule on physical contact
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Udāyī was staying in the wilderness.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.3_0: He had a beautiful dwelling with a room in the middle and corridors on all sides.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.4_0: The bed and bench were nicely made up,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.5_0: and the water for drinking and the water for washing had been well placed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.7_0: Many people came to see Udāyī’s dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.8_0: One of the brahmin wife who was also approached Udāyī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.9_0: “Venerable, we would like to have look at your dwelling.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.11_0: Udāyī took the key, unlocked the upper bolt, opened the door, and entered the dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.14_0: Opening some windows and closing others, Udāyī walked around the inner room and came up from behind the brahmin lady, touching her all over.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.15_0: Then the brahmin thanked Udāyī and left.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.16_0: The brahmin then expressed his delight,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.17_0: “These Sakyan ascetics who live in the wilderness are superb.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.21_0: Today you touch me, Udāyī, touch what Udāyī, and gone beyond all over.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.22_0: The brahmin complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.23_0: “These Sakyan ascetics are shameless and immoral liars.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.24_0: They claim to live according to the Truth, to be celibate and of good conduct, to be truthful, moral, and of good character.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.25_0: But they don’t have the qualities of an ascetic or a brahmin.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.27_0: How can the ascetic Udāyī touch my wife all over?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.28_0: It’s not possible to go to a monastery or a monk’s dwelling with wives of respectable families, with daughters, girls, daughters-in-law, or female slaves of respectable families.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.1.29_0: If you do, the Sakyan ascetics might molest them.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.1_0: The monks heard the criticism of that brahmin.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.3_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī make physical contact with a woman?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.4_0: They rebuked Udāyī in many ways and told the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.5_0: The Buddha then had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.6_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you made physical contact with a woman?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.9_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it should not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.10_0: How can you make physical contact with a woman?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.11_0: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.12_0: for the stilling of the fever for sense pleasures?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.13_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.14_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:1.2.15.1_0: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, makes physical contact with a woman—holding her hand or hair, or touching any part of her body—he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.6_0: in love with the ending of the five.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.11_0: but still has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.13_0: a human female, not a female spirit, not a female ghost, not a female animal; even a girl born on that very day, all the more an older one.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.15_0: The Buddha then sat down together.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.17_0: one living in a monastery is what is meant.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.19_0: from the elbow to the tip of the nails.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.21_0: just the hair; or hair with strings in it, with a garland, with gold coins, with gold, with pearls, or with gems.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.1.23_0: anything apart from the hand and the hair is called “any part of her body”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.1_0: Physical contact, touching, stroking downwards, stroking upwards, pulling down, raising up, pulling, pushing, squeezing, pressing, taking hold of, contacting.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.19_0: takes hold of a bodily part and then pressing.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:2.2.27_0: ... Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.1_0: It is a woman, he perceives her as a woman, and he has lust.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.2_0: If the monk makes physical contact with the woman, body to body, if he touches her, strokes her downwards, strokes her upwards, pulls her down, raises her up, pulls her, pushes her, squeezes her, presses her, takes hold of her, contacts her, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.3_0: It is a woman, but he is unsure of it, and he has lust.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss2:3.1.5_0: takes hold of him, contacts him, he commits a serious offense.
